docs.snippet: As the vote on “Brexit” nears, an English Channel port is leaning toward Britain’s leaving the European Union and regaining control of its fishing grounds....
docs.lead_paragraph: As the vote on “Brexit” nears, an English Channel port is leaning toward Britain’s leaving the European Union and regaining control of its fishing grounds.
docs.abstract: Many residents of Brixham, England's biggest commercial fishing port, want Britain to take back control of waters within 200 miles of shore, now jammed with European vessels; their discomfort with European Union precedes June 23 referendum on whether to leave union.

headline.main: In Brexit Debate, English Fishermen Eye Waters Free of E.U.

docs.snippet: The Conservative Party (and by extension, Britain) is moving toward a new leader, while many people still don’t seem to know what “Brexit” is....

headline.main: ‘Brexit’ Briefing: Boris Johnson Isn’t Running; Jeremy Corbyn Seeks Labour Revolution

byline.contributor: Chad Bray and Iliana Magra contributed reporting.

docs.snippet: New polls suggest sentiment is gently shifting against Britain staying in the EU, ahead of prime minister David Cameron's promise of an 'in/out' referendum on EU membership by 2017. David Pollard reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: New polls suggest sentiment is gently shifting against Britain staying in the EU, ahead of prime minister David Cameron's promise of an 'in/out' referendum on EU membership by 2017. David Pollard reports.

docs.snippet: Britain has yet to leave the European Union, but the term for its departure — Brexit — has earned a place in the Oxford English Dictionary....

headline.main: Brexit: Year's Key Political Term Enters Oxford Dictionary

docs.snippet: Britain is confident of agreeing an exit deal with the European Union within the two-year timetable set out under Article 50 of the bloc's Lisbon Treaty, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain is confident of agreeing an exit deal with the European Union within the two-year timetable set out under Article 50 of the bloc's Lisbon Treaty, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday.

docs.snippet: The leaders of 27 European Union countries on Thursday rebuffed a bid by the EU legislature for a much bigger role in talks on Britain's exit from the bloc, an argument that detracted from efforts to show a united stand in the negotiations....
docs.lead_paragraph: The leaders of 27 European Union countries on Thursday rebuffed a bid by the EU legislature for a much bigger role in talks on Britain's exit from the bloc, an argument that detracted from efforts to show a united stand in the negotiations.

headline.main: EU Rebuffs Legislature's Bid for Bigger Role in Brexit Talks
headline.print_headline: EU Rebuffs Legislature's Bid for Bigger Role in Brexit Talks

docs.snippet: Britain must negotiate a Brexit bridging deal to avoid a "cliff edge" that forces banks to move jobs before they know what the new trading relations with the European Union will be, British lawmakers said on Thursday....

docs.snippet: A slump in British manufacturing is showing signs of lifting thanks to higher new orders at home and the prospect of more demand from abroad spurred by the fall in the value of the pound after June's Brexit vote, a survey showed on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A slump in British manufacturing is showing signs of lifting thanks to higher new orders at home and the prospect of more demand from abroad spurred by the fall in the value of the pound after June's Brexit vote, a survey showed on Monday.
